New Records: Kylian Mbappé scored his first European Championship goal and the first goal by a French player at Euro 2024.
Key Match Events: Kylian Mbappé scored a penalty in the 56th minute.
Robert Lewandowski equalized with a penalty in the 79th minute after his first attempt was saved but retaken due to a rule violation.
Lukasz Skorupski made several key saves to deny France's attackers.
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps expressed that the aim was to take first place but acknowledged the team's performance and chances created.
Deschamps mentioned the need to be more effective despite the opposing goalkeeper's fine saves.
Miscellaneous Highlights: France finished second in Group D and will face the second-placed team in Group E.
It is the first time in 12 years that France has failed to finish top of their group at a major tournament under Didier Deschamps.
The match was played in sweltering conditions in Dortmund, Germany.
